comment.author: 77318933@N08
comment._content: Question please: if I remember correctly, Poland was part of the Austro-Hungarian empire during the WWI. I wonder from what these peasant are escaping? Russians? I think it was a stalemate on the Eastern front as it was in the west. Germans? They were allied to Austria. Any info?

comment.author: 36604574@N05
comment._content:
You are wrong T.J 
In period 1795-1918 Poland was under Russian,Prussian and  Austro-Hungarian  occupation .

comment.author: 77318933@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/36604574@N05] Thanks for correcting me. So, these refugees are escaping whom and where to?

comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content: My guess is they were escaping from anyone who was shooting.  The peasants didn't really have a 'side' just wanted to be left alone to try and work the farm and have shelter and food.
